title: Science in the orchestra
creator_credit: Realist Films, Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group, Brian Smith, Dorothy Grayson and Alex Strasser
brief_description: An exposition of the physics of orchestral sound for young people and adults. Conductor Muir Mathieson of the London Symphony Orchestra, and a physics demonstrator reveal facts about sound which fall into three sections, namely, 1. hearing the orchestra; 2. exploring the instruments; 3. looking at sounds.
